text: The 1998 ACC Trophy was a cricket tournament in Nepal, taking place from October 3 to October 13, 1998. It gave Associate and Affiliate members of the Asian Cricket Council experience of international one-day cricket and also helped form an essential part of regional rankings. The tournament was won by Bangladesh who defeated Malaysia in the final by 8 wickets. This would be Bangladesh's final ACC Trophy title prior to their elevation to Test status in 2000. ==Teams== The teams were separated into two groups of five.
